intro: Phlomoides gymnoclada, commonly known as the smooth-stemmed phlomoides, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb with slender, erect stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, arranged in whorls along the stem, and it blooms during the summer months. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils.
